div1.p: Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia May 12th 1888. (Written at Washington)
Mr. Smith To the Department of State.
Accepting appointment. Enclosing bond and oath. Answering enquiry as to birth
Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia May 12th 1888
Honorabl Geo. L. Rives Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of the Departments communication of May 1st (No 1 Dip Series) apprising me of my appointment as Minister Resident and Consul General of the United States to Liberia, and enclosing blank forms of official bond and oath to be executed.
I hereby accept the appointment with which the President has honored me; and I return herewith the bond and oath of office duly executed.
I was born in North Carolina and am appointed from that state. I have never resided in Liberia. Awaiting
I have the honor to be Sir, your obedient Servant.
